message.content: Trifolium campestre, commonly known as field clover, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the legume family. It typically reaches heights of about 20-40 cm. The leaves are trifoliate and alternate in arrangement with smooth margins. The flowers of Trifolium campestre are small and yellow, cone-shaped, and gathered in dense, round clusters. The fruits are small, round pods. The plant prefers dry and sandy soils, and is commonly found in meadows, grasslands, and pastures. It is a popular food source for grazing animals, and is also used in traditional medicine for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties. Visually, it has a soft texture and typically has a green color with yellow flowers.
